storyInfo: Melanie talks about her past rivalry with Marianne, prompting Tippi to decide to help her create the perfect scene. Under the guidance of the 'God of Inspiration', Steven turns Lucian into the savior of his script, and the lead of its grand finale.

attributes.content: I've come up with a few initial concepts for Lady Dupont's finale.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: You're an expert background painter, and quite versatile too. I need you to help me put together the best possible scene.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: Here, these are a few materials I cobbled together. Have a look.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: Wow, how'd you get all these art references and reference shots?
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Tint, ambience, design philosophy... You even labeled all the details of the buildings and how the lighting would reflect off different materials!
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: How long have you been doing research for this scene, ma'am?
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: A few years at this point. Time is about the only thing I have these days. It takes a lot more than reading the words off a script to make an excellent film.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: Director Quay's not even done fixing up the script yet, and you've already come up with so many ideas for the ending!
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: That lad's certainly taking his sweet time with it, yes. I believe that, both as the leading lady of The Death of Lady Dupont and its investor, I have an obligation to take responsibility for this film.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: As I said before, the revival of my career in Wrankwood will begin once Lady Dupont gets a good, proper death.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: Lupukarn Holiday, The Portrait of Erin Daz, The Bridges of County March... These mood reference shots are all taken from films starring Marianne Blake, aren't they?
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Do you... like her work?
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: She retired long before you were born.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: Er, I mean, like, my dad really loves her films! Besides, the classics are classics for a reason, right?
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Both her acting chops and taste in projects were impeccable.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: It's... kinda surprising to hear you say that. I could've sworn you hated her. Everyone's been comparing you guys for years.
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Indeed. All those years...
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: Congratulations on winning your eighth Best Actress award, Miss Blake!
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Ever since you started your career, you've been at least nominated for an award practically every year. The industry sees you as an insurmountable mountain for fresh new talent to try and climb.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Are there any particular up-and-comers you think we should keep an eye on?
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: I appreciate the flattery, but I'm hardly an 'insurmountable mountain'. I'm still climbing my way up myself.
attributes.name: Marianne

attributes.content: There are always plenty of new faces streaming into Wrankwood, brimming with talent, and it's hard for me to pick any specific name—
attributes.name: Marianne

attributes.content: How about Melanie Rutherford?
I tip my hat to you, Miss Blake.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: Today I received the award for Best Supporting Actress, two years slower than it took you.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: I've seen all your films. As our reporter friend here said, you really are a natural-born performer, the tallest peak in Wrankwood... but only for now.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: Give me some time, and I will overcome you.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: Well, I'm looking forward to it.
attributes.name: Marianne

attributes.content: Wow, Melanie and Marianne are really duking it out this scene. Time to get out the popcorn.
attributes.name: Newly-Joined Assistant

attributes.content: They've been rivals for a while now, haven't they? It's like they're always racing to get the most awards. So why'd they agree to be in the same project?
attributes.name: Newly-Joined Assistant

attributes.content: Shh! Did you forget everything they taught you when you joined the crew, you rude little shit? Go apologize to Miss Rutherford right now!
attributes.name: Veteran Coordinator

attributes.content: I-I'm really sorry!
attributes.name: Newly-Joined Assistant

attributes.content: Let's not be too harsh on the fresh meat, Melanie.
attributes.name: Marianne

attributes.content: 'Our films are built upon rules.' You've been in the industry longer than I have, Miss Blake. You must have experienced why they're so important firsthand.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: 'Courtesy towards the leading lady' is something we've had to fight for, role by role, film by film. It's what allowed me, a young girl from the middle of nowhere, to stand in front of you today.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: And without rules, there will be no standards. How else would we know which of us is the greatest film actress of all time?
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: Which reminds me, I still haven't congratulated you for that Best Actress award you got at Leithanien's Spire Film Festival a few days ago.
attributes.name: Marianne

attributes.content: That was just a small award ceremony. Meanwhile, your latest film swept every single major award in Wrankwood, again.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: I still haven't truly overcome you, Miss Blake.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: I would like to thank everyone for coming to this press conference regarding The Eternally Shining Star.
attributes.name: Marianne

attributes.content: We appreciate your care and concern during this difficult time. The rumors are true: our film crew really did run into a Catastrophe during our shoot. I was injured, and am still recovering now.
attributes.name: Marianne

attributes.content: Thankfully, we didn't return empty handed. We managed to hold onto some of our precious, precious footage.
attributes.name: Marianne

attributes.content: But I believe this is Heaven working in mysterious ways. It's trying to tell me that.... it's time for me to bid farewell to the silver screen.
attributes.name: Marianne

attributes.content: As both the lead actress of The Eternally Shining Star and its investor, I am hereby announcing that neither the film nor my performance will be submitted for nomination for any awards.
attributes.name: Marianne

attributes.content: It will remain as one last gift from Marianne Blake to her cinephile friends, and nothing more.
attributes.name: Marianne

attributes.content: I won't be leaving Wrankwood immediately, of course. Just moving into more of a behind-the-scenes role for now.
attributes.name: Marianne

attributes.content: But I doubt I'll be content with that for long. I'm always eager to seek new opportunities, to start a new chapter of my life as 'Jara Booker Wilson'.
attributes.name: Marianne

attributes.content: Oh, you're here too, Miss Rutherford. Could I request a quick interview?
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Your latest film will be releasing soon, and most were predicting that only you and Miss Blake would be in the running for this year's Best Actress at the Wrankwood Awards.
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: So how do you feel about the announcement of her sudden retirement, and the withdrawal of her new movie from the nominations?
attributes.name: Reporter

attributes.content: Does this mean...
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: I won?
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: After Jara—err, Miss Blake retired from acting, you got all those roles as brand spokeswoman and lead actress, and even got invited to be on the judging panels for the big film festivals.
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: But not long after, you suddenly left it all behind because... some personal reasons. And when you came back last time—
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Nothing was the same anymore.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: Her retirement gave me quite the shock, but I still believed I had won fairly, through my own talent.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: I believed that I, too, could become an 'insurmountable mountain' and a legend of the silver screen. One that outshone even her.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: But in the end, Wrankwood's Best Actress Melanie Rutherford let it all go to her head, swayed by the endless praise of the critics, the flattery of the sponsors, and the applause of the audience.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: Wealth and fame, alcohol and scandal... I lived an... indecent life, those few years.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: Yeah, tell me about it. Those tabloids have, like, zero respect for your privacy!
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: But once I met you in person, I could tell. Maybe you've made a few mistakes here and there, but your love for acting's the real deal.
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: No need to console me, little Liberi. No one's more acutely aware of my failings than I am.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: Marianne could switch from a hardened soldier to a poor servant girl and back again at the drop of a hat. A single dress rehearsal was all she needed to figure out the ideal lighting and positions.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: But if I were ever to take a single day off, spend one hour less on studying the script, or arrive at the rehearsal fifteen minutes late, my performance would fall into the gutter.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: A mere two years of living in indulgence was all it took for me to lose the skills I once picked up with ease. I disappointed both the directors and the fans.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: I had never realized just how many unending waves of new talent were looking up to me. I had never realized what the position in entertainment Marianne had fought so hard to defend actually meant.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: I thought I could afford to be like her, and enjoy the double delights of cinema and life. I thought there'd be no harm in having a little fun after all those chasing and competing.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: It was only then that I finally realized Marianne Blake was a truly infuriating genius... In every sense of the term.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: With her final film, and that chance Catastrophe... Marianne received a revelation to retire from cinema, and all I could do was sigh. Even unknowable Mother Nature was on her side.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: But now that you're a lead actress again, you've got the chance to win back everyone's trust!
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: I mean, you're even getting to film alongside a Catastrophe too!
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: You're right. I've spent more than a decade piecing my self-confidence and acting skills back together. I could very well be but a single step away from the top again.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: Greta's offer to give me the part of Lady Dupont couldn't have come at a better time, and now, even her grand ambitions have left me a special little 'gift'.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: Come to think of it, the Lady is a rather fitting role for me.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: Surely she knows her brother is lying to her? Surely she has doubted her last name once or twice?
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: But no, she unconsciously clings to her glamorous life, refusing to accept the mediocrity of her birth. She prays desperately that she is special, that she is talented.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: I wonder, what sort of ending will she face, amidst the storm?
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: Miss Rutherford.
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Yes?
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: We should watch some horror flicks together!
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Horror flicks...?
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: If you want to climb your way back to the top, you can't limit yourself to copying Miss Blake, right? Like, you've always had pretty different styles of acting.
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: We're gonna put together a finale more powerful than the one in Lupukarn Holiday, and Lady Dupont's name will go down in cinema history!
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: Ha. Very well then.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: Also...
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: I'm sure you know what happened between you and Miss Blake better than I do, but I bet she meant it when she said you'd surpass 'Marianne Blake' one day.
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: She might still think so, even now.
attributes.name: Tippi

attributes.content: You might be right.
attributes.name: Melanie

attributes.content: You, you're... Are you real, or just a figment of my imagination? Am I really being visited by the god of inspiration?
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Don't tell me I've gone crazy from working on this script...
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Madness can transform ink on the page into sweet fruit, or allow a stiff mind to wander freely across the wilderness of time and space.

You cower in the corner of a dark room, forced to chase a deadline even after witnessing a string of brutal murders. Yet, for all your soul-searching and brain-racking, you have come up with only three endings for Lady Dupont.
Hardly the work of a madman, no?
I promised Greta I'd have an ending that'd impress everyone by tonight. The only people left are those insane enough to risk their lives for cinema, and they're waiting for me.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: But they bet on the wrong man.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: The realm of art only accepts natural-born geniuses, not some dried-up piece of crap slaving away at a typewriter!
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: The Death of Lady Dupont... You already have the most captivating ending for this story just from its title.
While the shocking brilliance of her death will certainly fade after the film is copied reel after reel...
But Wrankwood, after all, is a factory hawking such fantasies all across Terra, is it not?
You are a nation of liars, fooling even yourselves. Even the Columbian dream was born from a promotional film for the Pioneer project, after all.

Just to be clear, I care for neither political metaphors nor realities, only that you have deeply misunderstood the essence of performance. Drama can change lives, but it would never use such a... mechanical way.
But by setting death as Lady Dupont's ending, you show you still possess an intuition for drama.
Intuition?
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: No.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: When I was a student, I hated dragging death into the stories I wrote.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: I thought of it as a cheap trick, only good for plugging up holes in the plot or squeezing the right emotions out of the audience.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Actually talented writers could give a film a proper climax without it.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Then what changed you? A shocking memory, or perhaps some phantom pain you cannot recall?
I had the same problem five years ago when I was working with Greta on another project.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: She didn't mince words: she told me the back half of the script was too dull, and audiences would be falling asleep. If I didn't change it, it'd bomb at the box office.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: So I shut myself in my office just like I do now, pushing my mind to the brink of collapse but getting nothing out of it...
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: And then, Laura fell and died.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: An opportunity straight from Heaven, the perfect plot device.
Just as Greta expected, the rest of the film was panned by critics. But that scene alone became an overnight sensation, to the point that...
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: You started to see death as more than a cheap trick. Rather, as the most sincere form of expression, brimming with artistry.
Yeah...
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Seeing how you've had that sudden realization, all that has happened on this plate should provide you with nourishment.

A death while shooting, a deadly hallucination, bodies hanging from beams... With all this to inspire you, why not write them into your story, and let the same drama be performed both on and off the screen?
Because they're still not good enough.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Then what about turning away from those who have already exhausted their possibilities?
Wh-What do you mean?
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Who else in your story can ignite a spark in Lady Dupont's bosom? Who is distant enough from all the grudges and resentments, yet still able to bring about the most drama—
As well as the best of performances?
The Messenger... It's the Messenger who brought the bad news! He's the very trigger for Lady Dupont's new fate!
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Vengeance or repentance? Lady Dupont has a new choice to make, and at the same time, the Messenger must contend with the consequences of intervening in another's destiny...
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: This is it! This is the ending I wanted!
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: Lucian... Yes... I'll have Lucian be the star of the final scene...
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: You want me to become the lead actor...
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: That's right.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: I can't say I understand you, but I have a feeling that even if I hadn't approached you, you would've come to me anyway.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: You have the most potential of any actor I've ever seen.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: The Messenger doesn't have much screentime, but your performance added a complex and delicate core to a role that was originally a nothingburger.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: And I'm sure that whatever your goal here is, you won't be leaving before the shoot ends.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: If so, then why not do me a favor and help me out with this?
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: I'll give you time to think it over, of course. So far, it's just a thought I had, and I haven't spoken to Steven about it yet.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: He promised me the finished script by tonight, but honestly, I'm not optimistic.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: If only that god of his knocked on his door.
attributes.name: Greta

attributes.content: I see... Changing the focus to the Messenger was the only way to steer the plot towards brilliance!
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: I can already imagine the shock on everyone's faces when they read the new ending. Well, once I'm done with it.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: But...
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: I see you've added a lot of direction notes for his lines. Most of them are... quite detailed.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: While you were giving me advice on my writing just now, you mentioned the quirks of Lucian's performances, and where he likes to put pauses in dialogue.
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: You even told me which angle suits him best for close-ups to capture his most subtle expressions, and what kind of lighting best highlights his unique character...
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: It's like you've known him for a long, long time. Maybe even taught him—
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: So how did you know all these things about Lucian?
attributes.name: Steven

attributes.content: You called for me, Troupe Leader?
attributes.name: Playwright

attributes.content: Come with me, Playwright.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: The final act is underway, and as always, the entirety of the audience is enraptured by the 'performance' on-stage.
attributes.name: Playwright

attributes.content: It's rare for Whiteflower to return to the stage. Will you not toast to her once the performance is over?
attributes.name: Playwright

attributes.content: What of Blood Diamond and Abyss?
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: They are merely supporting roles this time. All their scenes have already concluded.
attributes.name: Playwright

attributes.content: The rotting stage mechanism has spread the blood of the 'magician's assistant' and the chosen 'lucky audience member' all over the stage. Their corpses have been stuffed into prop boxes, set afloat on the river to disappear forevermore...
attributes.name: Playwright

attributes.content: The magician herself completes her final show as she treads on a stage yet slick with blood.
attributes.name: Playwright

attributes.content: Blood Diamond and Abyss should have chiseled their way out of the boxes by now, and be on their way back to the stage for the curtain call alongside Whiteflower the magician.
attributes.name: Playwright

attributes.content: Should they, now?
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: And here I was, thinking those two children have turned performance into reality, disappearing forevermore...
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: As I recall, this was a new scene you added half a year ago while revising the script... During a night you claimed to have had a revelation?
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Leader...
attributes.name: Playwright

attributes.content: Come with me, Playwright.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: The show is far from over.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: He is my favorite leading man.
He once left me, but in the end, we shall be reunited.
